gang,
a while back, I bought a tanto with full koshirae ( minus the koz but 
thanks to one listeros, i found a match ).

The tsuba is that of a dragon ascending mt. Fuji.
After failing the magnet test, we determined it is of copper alloy ( 
shakudo ? ) to simulate iron.

I was looking at the Compton collection.............lo und behold I 
found an almost identical design tsuba  with the exception of the 
tsuba shape + mei ( mine is mumei ) .
If you have the Compton Christie's auction catalog, it's item # 179 ( 
volume 1 ) page 74-75.
The dragon is identical, the cloud+ Mt. Fuji is almost identical.
Compton's is listed as a Yanagawa school ( signed   Yanagawa Naoharu 
Isen  Noobushu ). The reverse also shows a Mt. Fuji in reflection.

Just thought you all may be interested to know..........

p.s.  Gorby,  figure out the  school of that sukashi tsuba yet ?

milt
